column1: The earliest films were in black and white, under a [1] long, without recorded sound and consisted of a single shot from a steady camera.
Sound ended the necessity of interruptions of [1] [1], revolutionized the narrative possibilities for filmmakers, and became an integral part of moviemaking.

Popular new media, including television (mainstream since the [1]s), home video (mainstream since the [2]s), and internet (mainstream since the [3]s) influenced the distribution and consumption of films.
[1] [1] film is a motion-picture film format released in 1965 by [2] [2] as an improvement over the older "Double" or "Regular" 8 mm home movie format.

The [1] was the first type of indoor exhibition space dedicated to showing projected motion pictures in the United States. Usually set up in converted storefronts, these small, simple theaters charged five cents for admission and flourished from about 1905 to 1915.
column5: The first successful permanent theatre showing only films was "The Nickelodeon", which was opened in Pittsburgh in 1905.
